result.execSummary:
The defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner was found guilty of Attempt Attempt Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$6,422.70 to Mary O.-M.  Restitution to be paid first.
Hearing 9/23/2015 for other victim.
**9/23/2015  $1,700.00 to Veronica M.  Joint and several with 15CF1800.

All court costs, fees and surcharges except the DNA are waived due to the imposition by the Court of restitution.  Defendant to pay DNA surcharge.
RESTITUTION AND DNA SURCHARGE to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with coactors Chyna I. and Lakey R.
No contact with victims Veronica M. and Mary O.-M.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders no other specific programing conditions.  Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs Assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
**12/1/2015  Honorable Dennis R. Cimpl.  Term of Extended Supervision commuted to two and a half (2 1/2) years.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing SEPTEMBER 17, 2015 received and filed. (25 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION
Per Order signed on 12/1/2015:  Term of Extended supervision commuted to two and a half years.
Commuting Term of Extended Supervision, signed and filed
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify length of extended supervision term.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Patrick Anderson for Jay Pucek  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On stipulation of parties Court orders restitution of $1700.00 joint and several with 15CF1800 to Veronica M.  Restitution to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in custody.  Jay Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 149 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable 
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- Obtain GED/HSED
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education
- No contact with:  co -actors Chyna I and Lakay R
- No contact with:  victims Veronica M and Mary O-M
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $6422.70 to Mary O-M;  Restitution to be paid first.  Court sets restitution hearing in Branch 19 for other victim on 9/23/2015 at 8:30 am..
All court costs, fees, and surcharges except the DNA are waived due to the imposition by the court of restitution.  Defendant to pay the DNA surcharge
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that DNA surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letter from defendant

Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and elements received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  As to Count 3:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State count is dismissed by the court.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Filed:  victim impact statements
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial, parties request a plea hearing date prior to the jury trial.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference and bail review, defense requests final pre-trial/plea hearing and jury trial dates.  Defense no longer wishes to address bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing MAY 4, 2015 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to STEPHEN SARGENT, 819 N. 6TH, MILWAUKEE, WI 53203. kl

Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in custody.  Ronald Dague for Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jeremy Fadness-Franklin Police Department Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mary O., Verinica M, and Co-actors Chyna Ivery, DML., DOB: 07/30/1998; LSR, DOB: 06/01/1999; DLC, DOB: 03/28/1999; and JJJ, DOB: 03/30/1999.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Camron Jermaine Ramon Turner in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Court withheld a plea as to Count 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
